fields.descriptive_line: Set of toy soldiers, German Army medical service with tent, hand-painted composite (Elastolin), canvas, wire and printed tinplate, O. M. Hausser and A. G. Lineol, Germany, c.1936
fields.physical_description:
[tent] Canvas tent, glued between two rectangular sheets of cardboard to form a base. The tent is supported by to lengths of wire, protruding through holes in the canvas. Both have flags of printed tinplate formed to represent rippling fabric, with a red cross on white background of both sides. A rectangular opening has been cut into the side of the tent for a doorway, and a rectangular piece of canvas has been stitched to the tent across the top of the door. This is supported to form a canopy by a piece of bent wire stitsched into the canopy. The canopy also has strips of a slightly darker canvas stitched, using red thred, down either side.
[stretcher] Canvas and wire stretcher. The frame is made from four pieces of wire, bent and soldered together. The canvas is folded and stitched around the frame.
[dog] Hand-painted composite dog, German Shepard, in running position with one front foot raised supported by a rectangular base. The dog has a light-grey underside, with darker brown back and flanks, yellow eyes and red mouth, opened, with nose and details picked out in black. With a brown collar around the neck, attached to a brown cylinder under the neck, at each end painted with a red cross on a white background. The base is painted in greens and brown to resemble grass, the underside, where unpainted, is black. 
[stretcher bearer - lineol] Hand-painted composite toy soldier, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, standing on an oval base. With green helmet and tunic, lighter grey trousers and dark brown, shiny boots. Also brown belt and bags, and a white armband on left arm, with a red cross. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint. The figure is walking forward, with arms at sides. Most of the right hand is missing, but the left hand has a hole through it, to allow a stretcher pole to be inserted.
[stretcher bearer] Four hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, standing on a grey oval base. With green helmet and tunic, lighter grey trousers and black, shiny boots. Also brown belt, strapping, bags and holster, and a white armband on left arm, with a red cross. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint. The figure is walking forward, with arms at sides. The hands have a hole through them, to allow a stretcher pole to be inserted.
[reclining on side] Three hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, reclining on left elbow, with right arm in a sling tied around the neck. With green tunics, black boots and light green trousers (part 3 has grey trousers). Details of insignia on tunics, and sling, is picked out in white. Hands and face are painted flesh-coloured, with facial details picked out in black and red, with brown hair. 

It is possible that b.67:3-2011 has been repainted subsequent to purchase, as is wearing different coulred uniform than other two examples, and is more carefully painted.
[doctor in cap] Two hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers (doctors), dressed in the uniform of the German Army under white hospital gowns, standing on an oval base. Both are wearing caps with black peaks and gold and blue detailing, and both are holding a black medical instrument in the left hand, the right hand on the hip. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red. One (part 7) has grey trousers and stands on a grey base. The other (part 8) has brown trousers and stands on a brown base. 
[doctor without cap] Hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldier (doctor), dressed in the uniform of the German Army with grey trousers and black shoes under white hospital gown, standing on a grey oval base. Holding a black medical instrument in the left hand, the right hand on the hip. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red.
[nurses walking] Two hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy figures (nurses), dressed in the uniform of the German Army with green cap and dress and light blue tights under white hospital apron, standing on a brown oval base. On the left arm is a white armband, with red cross painted, and a red cross is also painted on a white band around front edge of cap. A button is picked out in silver on the chest. Holding a black bag in the left hand, the right hand at the side. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red.
[nurse with cup] Hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy figure (nurse), dressed in the uniform of the German Army with green dress and light blue tights under white hospital apron and wearing a white nurse's cap, standing on a brown oval base. On the left arm is a white armband, with red cross painted, and a red cross is also painted on the front edge of the cap and on white ties at the throat. A button is picked out in silver on the chest. Holding a brown bag in the left hand, again with a red cross painted within a whire circle, the right hand is holding a cup, painted silver. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red, with brown hair.
[nurse crouching blue] Hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy figure (nurse), dressed in the uniform of the German Army with light blue dress and light blue tights and black shoes under white hospital apron and wearing a white nurse's cap, kneeling. On the left arm is a white armband, with red cross painted, and a red cross also on white ties at the throat. Alternate crosses and vertical dashes, in red, are also picked out across the front edge of the cap. Insignia are picked out in black on the collar, right arm and right and left cuff, the latter also with a red and white band.  The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red, with brown hair. The nurse is holding a bowl, painted brown with a silver interior, with her left hand, and a brown cup in her right hand. 
[nurse crouching green] Hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy figure (nurse), dressed in the uniform of the German Army with green dress and black shoes under white hospital apron and wearing a white nurse's cap, kneeling. On the left arm is a white armband, with red cross painted and a red cross also on the front edge of the cap. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red, with brown hair. The nurse is holding a bowl, painted silver with an orange interior, with her left hand, and a red cup in her right hand. 
[reclining on rucksack] Two hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, reclining on their rucksaks. Both have white bandages tied around the head and chin, the right arm in a white sling and right leg bandaged from the knee down, with black boot on left leg. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red. B.67:18-2011 has a green uniform, with red blood painted onto bandage of head and sling, and a brown and yellow rucksack. B.67:19-2011 has a grey uniform, with insignia on the shoulders and collar picked out in red, silver and black, and a grey and brown rucksack. It is possible the latter has been repainted at some point. 


[injured soldier striding] Hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldier , dressed in the uniform of the German Army standing on agrey oval base. Wearing a light-green greatcoat and trousers, darker green tunic and black boots, with a white bandage around the head and right arm tied in a sling. Also brown bag on left hip slung over right shoulder.  The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red and with brown hair. Traces of blue paint can be seen around face.
[soldiers with canteen] Two hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, standing on a brown oval base. With khaki helmet and tunic, light-brown trousers and black, shiny boots. Also brown or black belt, strapping and bags, with a brown rucksack with a red cross painted inside a white circle on the back. Also a white armband on left arm, with a red cross. Insignia are picked out on the uniform in white or blue, and the face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint. Holding a silver cup in the left hand, and pouring a grey or green canteen with the right.
[soldier striding] Hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldier, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, standing on a grey oval base. With green helmet and tunic, light-green trousers and black, shiny boots. Also tan and brown belt, strapping and bags, with a tan rucksack with a red cross painted inside a white circle on the back. Also a white armband on left arm, with a red cross. Insignia and details are picked out on the uniform in black, with silver buttons and belt buckle. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint. 
[injured soldier on the arm of soldier] Tableau of two hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, walking arm in arm and dressed in the uniform of the German Army, standing on a grey base. Both are wearing a green tunic, light-green trousers and black boots, with red piping on trousers and tunics. The figure on the right is injured, with the right arm in a white sling tied around the neck. The figure on the left is wearing a cap with black peak and white band, on which is painted a red cross, and a white armband on the left arm, also with a red cross. He is also wearing a black belt, with brown and black bag and silver canteen, and is carrying a greatcoat over left arm. The face and hands of both figures are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint, although much of this has worn away to reveal a brown ground.
[piggy back soldier] Tableau of two hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, one carrying the other on his back, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, standing on a grey base. Both are wearing a green tunic, light-green trousers and black boots, with red piping on trousers and tunics. The figure being carried is injured, with a white bandage tied around the head and neck. The other figure is wearing a cap with black peak and white band, on which is painted a red cross, and a white armband on the left arm, also with a red cross. Both are wearing a black belt, with brown and black bag. The face and hands of both figures are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint, although this has worn away in parts to reveal a brown ground.
[seated soldier with doctor] Tableau of two hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, one a doctor plastering the arm of the other, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, on a square brown base. The seated soldier is wearing a green tunic, light-green trousers and black boots, with a white bandage tied around the head and the right arm also in bandages from the elbox down. He is sitting on a brown box.  The other figure, standing up, is wearing a white, full-length medical gown, a green cap with black peak and black boots. Insignia and a band are picked out on the cap in black, silver and red paint. The face, forearms and hands of both figures are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint. A light-brown rucksack is at the doctor's feet.
[three soldiers] Tableau of three hand-painted composite (Elastolin) toy soldiers, two carrying the third seated on a branch between them. All are standing on a grey base, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, wearing a green tunic, light-green trousers and black boots. The figure being carried is injured, with a white bandage tied around the head and tunic unbuttoned showing a white shirt. The other figures are wearing caps with black peaks and white band, on which is painted a red cross, and a white armband on the left arms, also with a red cross. Their tunics have detailing on the collars, shoulders and cuffs in blue paint. Both are wearing a brown belt, with silver and grey canteen and bag hanging behind. All three have buttons on their tunics picked out in gold. The face and hands of the figures are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red paint.
[soldier on back] Hand-painted composite toy soldier, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, lying on his back, to be placed on a canvas stretcher (b.67:30-2011). Wearing a green tunic and trousers, with black belt and silver buttons. With the right arm in a white sling and left leg bandaged from the knee down, with black boot on left leg. The face and hands are painted flesh-colour, with facial details picked out in black and red. In places, much of the paint has been rubbed off, to reveal the grey/brown colour of the composite material underneath.


[stretcher and soldier] Hand-painted composite toy soldier, dressed in the uniform of the German Army, lying on a stretcher. With the right arm in a sling tied around the neck, and a bandage tied around the head, wearing green tunic, black boots and light green trousers. Details of insignia on tunic is picked out in white on the collar and cuffs. Hands and face are painted flesh-coloured, with facial details picked out in black and red, with brown hair. The stretcher is brown, with two lengths of wire, now rusting, moulded into the underside of it's length, protruding at either end to act as handles. The stretcher has two feet moulded at the foot end (the two from the head end having been broken off).

fields.name: Museum of Childhood, Temporary Exhibition Gallery

fields.public_access_description:
This group of toy soldiers, representing injured soldiers, doctors and nurses in the German army in the 1930s, was not originally sold as a set, but is made up of individual pieces, from two separate  manufacturers, purchased separately and brought  together. The majority of the figures were  manufactured by O. M. Hausser, a leading German manufacturer of toy soldiers, but the set also includes at least one figure produced by A. G. Lineol,  Hausser's main competitor. All of the  figures were manufactured in Germany in the mid- 1930s. 

	They are made from a composite material, which includes substances such as plaster, glue, sawdust and  linseed oil mixed together, which is then  pressed into a mould around a wire armature,  heated and dried and then hand-painted. The  particular composite mixture used by Hausser was given the trade name 'Elsastolin'. 

	This set reflects the trend amongst toy manufacturers  to mirror the real world in terms of new armies,  regiments, changes in uniform and equipment and  methods of warfare. The fact that the injured troops are German and were manufactured by a German company indicates that this trend towards realistic depiction can include the more disturbing aspects of war, and can show loss as well as victory.

fields.uncertainty: assumed, due to size of figure, although no maker's mark is apparent
assumed - there is no maker's mark.

fields.history_note: This set is made up of individual figures collected together, produced by two different manufacturers - the majority of figures were produced by O M Hausser, with a small number manufactured by A G Lineol. They were purchased at auction in May 2011. Their history subsequent to manufacture before acquisition is unknown.
fields.historical_context_note: As toys, these soldiers would have originally been played with by children, although objects such as these have subsequently become popular with adult collectors. They reflect the trend amongst toy manufacturers, especially manufacturers of toy soldiers, to mirror the real world in terms of newly formed regiments, armies, changes in uniform and eqipment and methods of warfare. They were produced as accurate representation of a field hospital.
